label: 朝臣
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Ranked as No. 2 in 684, being given to powerful Imperial Chieftains (Omi) and Deity Chieftains (Muraji). Since the Fujiwara clan held this hereditary title became the most powerful clan in Japan, Ason became the most coveted hereditary title and came to rank as No. 1, supplanting Mahito. [姓、臣、連、藤原、真人]
